result.execSummary:
The defendant Shirley Ann Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS approved by agent or the court.
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Parenting classes.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
Comply with all Children's Court orders.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: Serve 30 days PER COUNT in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1/8/16 at 1:30pm in Branch 38.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shirley Ann Hill in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Shirley Ann Hill in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 6 (amended):
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for zero days time served.
AS TO COUNT 7 (amended):
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for zero days time served.
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 30 days PER COUNT in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1/8/16 at 1:30pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS approved by agent or the court.
-Comply with all Children's Court orders
-Maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Shirley Ann Hill in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court commences sentencing hearing and hears arguments from the state.  Defendant makes statement to the court and does not take responsibility for actions taken.  The court will adjourn matter for defense to determine if motion for plea withdrawal will be filed or proceed to sentencing on next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

by the court that the defendant is allowed to have agency supervised visitation with children.  Defendant is not allowed to discuss the activities or circumstances surrounding the case.  The no contact order remains in effect between the defendant and co-defendants.   mld

Defendant Shirley Ann Hill in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO AMENDED COUNTS #6 and #7:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 9-25-2015 at 8:15 am.  

Court heard and granted defense motion to modify the no contact order.  Court ordered that the defendant is allowed to have agency supervised visitation with children.  Defendant is not allowed to discuss the activities or circumstances surrounding the case.  The no contact order remains in effect between the defendant and co-defendants.   

Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 8-3-2015 at 8:15 am in Branch 38.  mld

Defendant Shirley Ann Hill in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED COUNT #6 and AMENDED COUNT #7 to Neglecting a Child, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 948.21(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor."   mld

Defendant Shirley Ann Hill in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case passed.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
NOTICE TO OFFER VIDEO-RECORDED INTERVIEWS OF CHILDREN AT TRIAL.
STATE'S.
TO ADMIT VIDEOTAPED STATEMENT IN THE INTERESTS OF JUSTICE UNDER 908.08.
STATE'S REQUESTED JURY INSTRUCTIONS.
NOTICE OF EXPERT TESTIMONY.

Defendant Shirley Ann Hill in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The following co-defendant cases were called simultaneously: Cases 2015CF2207, 2015CF2208 and 2015CF2209.    
DEMAND for Speedy Trial was entered on 5-22-2015 for case 2015CF2208.
Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by counsel, Court ordered the following cases CONSOLIDATED for the purposes of trial: Cases 2015CF2207, 2015CF2208 and 2015CF2209.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-28-2015 at 8:30 am and Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 8-3-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Court vacates the Pretrial Conference date of 6-25-2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 4.   mld
to Adjourn Speedy Trial, from the State, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Shirley Ann Hill in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for Abbey DeSiato for the State of Wisconsin.  
This is a co-defendant case with case 2015CF2208.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Police Reports were provided to defendant counsel.  Additional discovery and an offer will be forthcoming to defense, per the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-25-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including Justice Point Supervision, no possession of dangerous weapons, no contact with KR (6-9-01), KMR (9-7-04), or co-defendants Tony Hill or Melvin Malone.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

05/17/2015

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: KR (6/9/01); KMR (9/7/04); Co-Defendants: Tony Hill; Melvin Malone.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shirley Ann Hill in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Shirley Ann Hill in custody. 
 Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. 
Motion to dismissCOUNT 7 by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
